ygData.subject: Re: Selling to Krak?
ygData.msgSnippet: Aviak s have no faction so are immune to Carillon.  Sounds like they have have fixed the sneak/sell bug.  Where you behind him when you tried to sell? Rokenn
ygData.messageBody:
Aviak's have no faction so are immune to Carillon. Sounds like they have
have fixed the sneak/sell bug. Where you behind him when you tried to sell?

Rokenn


>From: "J L Smith" <slider@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: [eqbards] Selling to Krak?
>Date: Thu, 3 Feb 2000 09:01:56 -0600
>
>Last night I tried to sell to Krak, the vendor at the top of the Aviak
>village in SK. I conned dubious at first and he told me nicely where the
>exit was. Carillon, with flute or without, would not raise my faction above
>dubious, and did not change his response. With sneak I got him to
>indifferent, but he still wouldn't sell. His response was different,
>though,
>saying that he doesn't talk to Half-Elves, much less sell to them.
>
>I may have lost faction a while back when someone pulled Krak down to the
>ramp and I whacked on him before I knew who he was. Think I was still in
>the
>zone when he died.
>
>I can still sell to centaurs, so no worries. Just curious about others'
>experience with Krak boy and Carillon not doing anything.
>
>Operaman
><Spirit of the Moon>
>Innoruuk
>
>Date: Wed, 2 Feb 2000 16:48:18 -0500 (EST)
> From: <kim@...>
>Subject: Re: Mask of Deception and ultravision
>
>On Wed, 2 Feb 2000, Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4 wrote:
> >
> > You would sing carillon first before sneaking. The faction bonus it
>gives
> > lasts until you zone. You then either activate illusion or sneak. I'm
> > almost 100% certain the illusion will give you a better /con than
>sneaking
> > so thats the best way to go.
>
>I'm pretty sure sneaking just sets you to indifferent with a
>merchant regardless of faction (it's really a bug that you can
>use it at all to shop). So if illusion+song results in higher
>than indifferent faction, it will be better than
>sneak+anything else.
>
>--
>John H. Kim
>kim@...
>
>
>
>
>
